subject: Re: [junit] Perform something before and after a complete test
msgSnippet: ... I consider the use of tearDown() a smell. -- J. B. Rainsberger, Diaspar Software Services http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603 Let s write
messageBody:
David Plass wrote:

> In other words, do we EVER really need 'tearDown'? I do see the need for
> setUp, especially if you need to construct (horror) interlinked mock
> objects. But why bother 'nulling' out your locals? They'll be GC'ed anyway,
> right?

I consider the use of tearDown() a smell.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
